Note_result: the time from landing on the perch in front of the butterfly until the attack was launched
Note_stimulus: butterfly; birchbark as the background ; Authors made P. aegeria specimens eyespotless by detaching their forewings. Second, using a razor, they care-fully cut out the ventral apical eyespot from the forewing of L. megera specimens, and, from the sames pecimen, an equally large circular piece below the eyespot that functioned as a control marking. The cut-out circles, comprising a conspicuous eyespot or a dull brownish control, were glued onto the forewing-less P. aegeria specimens a few millimeters from the lower end of the hindwing margin
